subject: Home & DIY
title: The Fire Triangle Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Fire Triangle Explained.

hook.text: Every fire needs exactly three things: heat, fuel, and oxygen. Remove any one and the fire dies instantly.

buildup.text: This is the fire triangle. Firefighters don't just spray waterâ€”they strategically remove one side of the triangle.

discovery.text: Water cools (removes heat). Foam smothers (removes oxygen). Firebreaks clear vegetation (remove fuel).

twist.text: Your kitchen has all three in abundance: gas or electric heat, cooking oil as fuel, and open air for oxygen.

climax.text: Fire extinguishers are labeled A/B/C for different fuels. Using the wrong one on a grease fire makes it explode.

punchline.text: Three ingredients create every fire on Earth.

quiz.question: What are the three elements of the fire triangle?
